loader.title: FECHULI BROADCAST SYSTEM
loader.disclaimer: No designer was exploited during the creation of this website, no absurd requests were made, no impossible brief was delivered at the last minute. But, most importantly, no changes were requested during the creation process. Everything went perfectly according to plan.
loader.note: If you're reading this text, you clearly have nothing better to do. I understand, I've been there too. Welcome to the club.

aboutSection.title: About me
aboutSection.intro: Hi, I'm Federico, born in 1998 in Florence. Ever since my dad brought the PlayStation 2 home, I've had an unbridled passion for video games. This passion drove me to study computer science and specialize in game development.
aboutSection.theater: However, life sometimes takes unexpected turns and after the first years of school I abandoned the idea. For many years of my adolescence I practiced theater at Teatro Puccini in Florence.
aboutSection.studio: In the meantime, I opened a recording studio with my friend and collaborator Lorenzo, with whom I shared 6 years of music production and DJ sets. In those years were born the:
aboutSection.backdoor: In 2019, together with Tommaso, Duccio and Lorenzo, I opened Backdoor Studio, which is currently the place where I work and spend my days.

cta.text: Click below to learn more about me and my passions!

contact.title: Let's get in touch
contact.description: Feel free to write to me on my social media or send me an email for any questions or proposals

images.caption1: Dinner at Hallasan, one of the best Korean restaurants in Florence
images.caption2: Lorenzo and I during a classic DJ set
images.caption3: Lorenzo and I at Tenax, a famous Florentine nightclub
images.caption4: Duccio and Nicco in the studio working on NFTs
images.caption5: Orso *my dog* and Duccio in the studio
images.caption7: Dudade (right) and Vieri (left) sleeping in the studio, Lore celebrates
images.caption8: Lorenzo and I in the elevator
images.caption9: Purrino *my cat* yawning on the terrace

sys.welcome:
FECHULI BBS v0.0.1_alpha
══════════════════════════════════════════
Welcome.
System online since 2025.
══════════════════════════════════════════

Type 'help' for available commands.
sys.aboutText:
╔══════════════════════════════════════╗
║  FEDERICO FIASCHI                    ║
╚══════════════════════════════════════╝

  Digital Craftsman
  Location: Florence, Italy
  43.7696° N, 11.2558° E

  Creator of Backdoor Studio.
  Specialized in immersive and
  interactive web experiences.

  How do you define a programmer?
  By skills? By talent? By passion?
  By how much they remember that particular
  algorithm that allowed them to pass that
  extremely difficult leetcode problem?
  Probably none of these things.
  If I had to guess, I believe Robert C. Martin
  came closest of all.
  A programmer is defined
  by their ability to compare themselves to God.

  Available for collaborations and freelance projects.

q2: Click here and there, get bored and, simply, leave.
r4_changed: Strange. The last time we met
Or at least that's what they say.
r5_correct: At least you know where you are in time.
Not everyone can say the same.
q6: Do you think you have control over this site?
r6_yes: You're the one who pressed a button
questions that someone else is asking you.
And you think you have control.
r6_no: Or maybe you just figured out
is still a form of intelligence.
r7: I don't know if that's a good reason.
But at least it's a reason.

q2: You know, {name}, there are people who learn
It's pretty clear you're not one of them.
q3: What did you expect to find
r3: I suppose it makes sense to you.
q4: How many times do you think you can
r4_low: Or maybe just aware of your limits.
q6: not to leave you here in the dark.
r6: It's not the best reason I've heard.
But it's not the worst either.

q3: I could simply not answer you.
You would only see this black screen
forever, or until you get tired and leave.
q4: What do you think I should do
r4_something: Too bad you don't know what.
Or maybe you do and don't want to say.

q3: I don't have much more to tell you.
